author: Bitcoin_Chaca
body: We are short sighted when trading crypto. I am down $30,000. I bought Dogecoin at $.42 and have no money to DCA. I bought up Dogecoin because of the four year cycle. I expected it to have this parabolic rally by the end of May at the latest. I was picturing Lamborghinis and paying cash for a house blah blah blah. I’m doing the best I can to have the mindset to just buy and hold. I thought about deleting my Robinhood app and not looking at it for a year. A buddy of mine did that with bitcoin. He bought several years ago and literally deleted the app and didn’t look at it for three years and made a lot of money so you will too. You made a smart investment, but you need to be patient, both of us do. You will recoup your money and more. I feel your pain, chin up and HODL

author: liquid_at
body: Any decision you make without considering all possible outcomes can be a bad decision.  Doge is doing well. There is literally nothing you could have found out researching doge, that would have told you that the price would go down, because it wasn't doge that dropped, but the Fiat-Economy.   The only way you had to know that the market would drop would have required insider information from the current US administration, long before they were even inaugurated.   The reason all prices are down is because of the current US president, the current US president and the current US president. There is no other reason on earth for why the prices are down right now.   The reason has one name, one face and one braincell.

author: capofliberty

Energy stocks like power companies are a solid play right now.

author: notausername86
body: Every time I see one of these posts, I have one of two thoughts.   Either, op is one of those people who wanted to get rich quick, that never did any research about where they are choosing to put their money, and now that there is a down period they are freaking out. These people are the ones who will sell at a loss, or, if they are lucky, will hit their "break even point" and dip out.   Or, OP is in league with the "market forces" that come to manuplate sentiment on social media, so those people with big pockets can snatch up even more coins at a cheaper price.   I for one, see the master class in 5D chess moves that are being played in the markets right now. I will continue to DCA with every free dollar I have. Either, you understand what's going on, or you dont.   Fear is the mindkiller, though.

author: Amputee69
body: I just look at it from the point that if I really need money, I still have a few dollars here, BTC, and my automotive stocks. Doge is nowhere near as good as we want. It's nowhere as good as having this money in a bank. But there are a few dollars left. Am I worried? Nope. But that's just me. If I spent my time worrying about money or how I'm addressed, my mental health would suck so bad, I couldn't be cured. I've owned the "other coin" longer than Doge. Right now, both are down from when I first bought in. It was about 3 years ago I bought the other. Not a FULL COIN! But an investment I could afford. This past Winter I STARTED buying Doge. It's been going down ever since. If BTC goes up (which it will) Doge will follow. It may never hit a Dollar, but anything positive, IS POSITIVE. Ride it out, or take it out.

author: TodaysThoughts21
body: I would suggest in the future no matter whether crypto or stocks you buy at different price points if its a slow mover so you hold when it's low and still be able to sell something needed when even you bought low, you keep the higher for when it goes up. Such as saying you bought around 0.30 Sell when it goes up. Buy when it's 0.13 sell when it's 0.15 to 0.16 low. You still have options if selling is what you want. Don't ever dump a ton on just one side. Then your stuck.

author: liquid_at
body: That's the point... Some people seem to claim that "doge dropped" and how "those predicting a bull market were wrong", when everything that was predicted about crypto did work out, but only the unpredictable insanity of the presidency wasn't predictable.   But as you say, it was not forseeable that a president would knowingly and willingly destroy his own country. The sum of terrible decisions is beyond anything we've seen from presidents. We have to assume it was on purpose because it is highly unlikely that a single human being can be this incompetent.

author: ShadoWolfcG
body: Bro, he threatened to do this for months before the election. Anybody who just happens to fall onto a TV remote and turn on the news for about 4 seconds knew he wanted to do this.   He spent the last administration alienating us from our allies. He's been talking about leaving NATO for like a year and spent the whole election cycle talking about tariffs. Doge hit .50, and I sold all of it, knowing it would crater the moment he got into office.   Now I'm going back in because it'll probably go up in the future, but I made my money, and I'm coming back for round two.

author: natasevres
body: That Trump would go full rogue and start a global tariff war within the first 6 months in Office?  Using methods that bypasses congress and the senate. This is not normal tarriffs, these are methods of sanctions but on a global scale.  Só no.  You can pretend to be captain hindsight. But the reality is far worse. China could start selling american treasury bonds already tomorrow, which will send the american debt in a spiral far worse than what we have ever seen.  We are already seeing a 4% decline daily - comparable only to the depression of 1929.   Just give me a break already. This is unprecedented even for Trump. The american empire died today - going against China.

This is a top 10 coin that made that massive move, higher market cap coins do not really do that often and is a win for those that bought at 0.05.  Now to get over $1 there needs to be some type of utility which is a pipe dream.   remember this post

author: Fulvio55
body: Too easy…  Go to coinb.in. Download a copy so you can run it locally offline.  Fire it up, fill in the boxes, sign the transaction, broadcast. Done.  Everything other than loading the UTXOs and broadcasting can and should be done offline.  And by the way, you don’t need actual paper for a wallet. A text file is much more convenient, just store it on removable media and never have it online.  You can find ELI5s and lots of detailed explanations if you do some searching. Start with ‘text wallet’.

author: Fulvio55
body: Never ever use any software on mobile devices. It’s just asking for trouble, as many have found.  Text wallets are the ONLY way.
